title: One Direction's rescheduled Belfast concert has angered ice hockey supporters
text:
One Direction's rescheduled Belfast concert has angered ice hockey supporters One Direction's rescheduled Belfast concert has angered ice hockey supporters 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
One Direction‚Äôs rescheduled concert has angered ice hockey team Sheffield Steelers, who hit out at the ‚Äúunacceptable‚Äù late postponement of their fixture with Belfast Giants on Friday night to make way for the group‚Äôs gig. What do you get when you mix @onedirection and Ice Hockey?? some very angry @steelershockey fans!! 
‚Äî Ben Hall (@Ben_Hall19) October 21, 2015 
The chart-topping band ‚Äì Niall Horan, Liam Payne, Harry Styles and Louis Tomlinson ‚Äì pulled out of a concert at the SSE Arena in Belfast on Tuesday after Liam fell ill, and the rescheduled show will now take place on Friday, in place of the Elite League game. 
The South Yorkshire ice hockey team were due to face the Giants in back-to-back games in Belfast, with the club as well as the supporters now facing the prospect of being left out of pocket. The Sheffield Steelers celebrate winning the Play-Off Trophy (Simon Cooper/EMPICS Sport) 
Steelers owner Tony Smith said: ‚ÄúThis is unacceptable and not the end of the matter.‚Äù 
Smith spoke out as Liam reassured fans he is ‚Äúmuch better‚Äù, as he prepared to perform at tonight and tomorrow‚Äôs shows, which are going ahead as planned. Promoted stories 
The 22-year-old singer apologised to his upset followers on Twitter. I'm so sorry to everybody I disappointed last night. I'm feeling better now. I really hope everyone can make the rescheduled date on Friday. 
The Tuesday show was due to be the first of three nights One Direction were due to play at the Northern Ireland venue during their On The Road Again tour. 
The match between Belfast Giants and Sheffield Steelers will be rescheduled for a later date. 
Neil Walker, general manager of the SSE Arena, Belfast, said: ‚ÄúHaving assessed all possible options, we can confirm that the cancelled One Direction concert from last night will go ahead this coming Friday night at The SSE Arena, Belfast. 
‚ÄúWe are extremely grateful to the Belfast Giants and Sheffield teams and apologise to their fans for the inconvenience caused ‚Äì we are very grateful to them for their understanding and accommodation of the nearly 10,000 young concert fans who were so devastated by the cancellation last night. We are now looking forward to three great nights of concerts at The SSE Arena, Belfast.‚Äù The One Direction tour bus outside the SSE Arena (Niall Carson/PA) 
Walker added: ‚ÄúWe apologise again for the inconvenience caused last night and reassure fans that The SSE Arena, Belfast, was only made aware of Liam‚Äôs illness just before the band was due to perform.‚Äù 
Tickets for the cancelled performance will be valid on Friday, with refunds available for those unable to attend the rescheduled show. 
Liam‚Äôs bandmates tweeted to fans disappointed at missing out on the show. Deepest apologies to everyone at the show tonight in Belfast. Very disappointed, but unfortunately these things happen. We're very sorry. H 
‚Äî Harry Styles. (@Harry_Styles) October 20, 2015 We're so so sorry for what happened tonight, it was out of our control ! Lots of love to Liam and thank you for being so understanding ! 
‚Äî Louis Tomlinson (@Louis_Tomlinson) October 20, 2015 So sorry we have had to cancel tonight guys. Unfortunately these things happen‚Ä¶ Thank you to all who came down tonight ! 
‚Äî Niall Horan (@NiallOfficial) October 20, 2015 
TV presenter Eamonn Holmes aired his dissatisfaction with the situation on Twitter. I don't care who was sick in #OneDirection Direction. Rest of them should have had the decency & maturity to appear on stage and explain. 
‚Äî Eamonn Holmes (@EamonnHolmes) October 20, 2015 
After One Direction fans reacted to his tweets, he added: For all of you who can't read , I didn't ask for #OneDirection to Sing , I asked for them to Apologise in person to fans who turned up. 
‚Äî Eamonn Holmes (@EamonnHolmes) October 20, 2015 
Fan reactions on social media ranged from anger to get well wishes. Remember when Howard from Take That broke his ribs and the rest of them went on without him?! Take note #onedirectionbelfast
